subject: Re: Problems using @BeforeClass with parallel methods
msgSnippet: Can someone please confirm whether you can reproduce this problem on your end? Here is a simple testcase: public class Testcase { @BeforeClass public static
messageBody:
Can someone please confirm whether you can reproduce this problem on your end? Here is a simple testcase:

public class Testcase
{
@BeforeClass
public static void beforeClass()
{
System.out.println("********** beforeClass");
}

@Test
public void one()
{
System.out.println("********** one");
}

@Test
public void two()
{
System.out.println("********** two");
}

@Test
public void three()
{
System.out.println("********** three");
}
}

if you run this with <parallel>methods</parallel> you should see tests executing before "beforeClass".

Gili

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kristian Rosenvold <kristian@...> wrote:
>
> on., 09.02.2011 kl. 09.35 -0500, skrev David Saff:

> >
> > I'm not sure about the implementation of the maven surefire plugin.
> > There might be a maven expert on this list who knows more. You might
> > also want to try the maven list.
>
> We're here. The plugin does little more than scan the classpath and
> forward to JUnitCore, so I think Musa has the correct solution.
>
> The provider code, which is not long, can be seen here;
> http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/maven/surefire/trunk/surefire-providers/surefire-junit47/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/surefire/junitcore/JUnitCoreProvider.java?view=markup
>
>
> Kristian
